poem:
Inheritance  

In the silent ledger of blood,  
a father's will etched divisions—  
the elder with weighted gold,  
the younger with shadows' cold embrace.  
Between them, the echo of love,  
unwritten, untold, unseen,  
in the fields where time harvests  
resentment's growing whisper,  
and the soul seeks what was never sown.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. My dad started a business when I was five. Now it’s worth several million. My brother was invited by my dad to go into the business when he left university. I was not. By then, the business was well established and my dad stayed on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
